result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey A. Kastning was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Unlawful Phone Use-Threaten w/ Obscenity [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.012(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay $500 plus costs with appropriate surcharges. 60 days to pay fine or set up a payment plan. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Katie Kinse.
Comply with the recommendations of the Sex Offender Registry Program.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey A. Kastning

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Jeffrey A. Kastning
Current: 3616 N Juanita Ln, Appleton, WI 54911-8457 United States  (Effective: 10-13-2015)
Prior: 511 N Superior St 4, Appleton, WI 54905

Defendant Jeffrey A. Kastning in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:02 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
State has complied with victim notification.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - No contest 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Halverson makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Halverson has 3 letters of recommendation and support of the defendant.
Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
Imposed/Stayed 180 day jail sentence
Placed on Probation for 12 months 
Pay fine of $500 plus costs with appropriate surcharges
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Katie Kinse
Comply with the recommendations of the Sex Offender Registry Program
60 days to pay fine or set up a payment plan

10:37 a.m. Attorney Acalia Halverson in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Halverson informs the Court of the Defendant's situation and requests matter to be rescheduled. BTC: Granted.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 09:00 am.
No contact with the Family Crisis Center or any of its employees.

Defendant Jeffrey A. Kastning in court with attorney Acalia Halverson. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

NOT GUILTY plea entered.

State recommends a $2,000 signature bond with conditions as stated.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.
